step1.sentence: Instead of waiting to be told what to do, Sarah decided to show initiative and redesigned the onboarding process on her own.

step2.story: Marcus noticed the team was struggling with disorganized meeting notes. Without being asked, he showed initiative by setting up a shared workspace and creating clear templates for everyone. His manager was impressed and praised him at the next all-hands meeting.

step3.story: When the project deadline was suddenly moved up by two weeks, the rest of the team panicked and waited for instructions. Elena, however, chose to show initiative — she pulled up the project board, identified the three biggest blockers, and drafted a revised timeline before the morning standup had even started. She sent it to her manager with a brief note explaining her reasoning. By the time the team meeting began, they had a clear path forward thanks to her. Her willingness to act without being prompted earned her a spot on the company's high-potential list.

meaning.realUsageKo: 지시나 허락을 기다리지 않고 스스로 판단해 먼저 행동할 때 사용하며, 주로 직장·학업 등 성과가 중요한 상황에서 긍정적인 평가를 받는 행동을 묘사합니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 'initiative'는 라틴어 'initium(시작)'에서 유래했으며, 어떤 일의 첫 발걸음을 내딛는다는 의미를 담고 있습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 '적극성'보다 한 단계 더 나아가, 남들이 행동하기 전에 상황을 파악하고 먼저 움직이는 자발적 주도성을 강조합니다. 비즈니스 영어에서 능력 있는 직원을 묘사할 때 자주 쓰입니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He showed initiative by preparing the report before his boss even asked for it.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 상사가 요청하기도 전에 보고서를 준비하는 주도성을 보여줬다.
